thread.title: Transfer news: The latest rumours from Man Utd, Chelsea, Arsenal and all the top teams
thread.title_full: Transfer news: The latest rumours from Man Utd, Chelsea, Arsenal and all the top teams

title: Transfer news: The latest rumours from Man Utd, Chelsea, Arsenal and all the top teams
text:
0 26-Feb-2017 05:34:00 Goal summarises the biggest transfer talk from the Premier League, La Liga, Serie A, the Bundesliga and beyond MAN UTD FAVOURITES TO SIGN DONNARUMMA 
Manchester United are firm favourites to sign Milan wonderkid Gianluigi Donnarumma, according to the Daily Mirror . 
The newspaper reports that the 18-year-old goalkeeper, who is valued at £40 million (€47m), has been identified by Jose Mourinho as a potential replacement for David de Gea, should the Spaniard leave Old Trafford. CHELSEA SLAP £127M PRICE TAG ON COSTA 
Diego Costa will cost Chinese Super League club Tianjin Quanjian a world record £127 million if Chelsea are to agree a deal, the Daily Star reports . 
The Spain international, who has been a key player for Antonio Conte's side this sason, has been linked with a move to China in recent months, but will command a hefty fee. BENITEZ WANTED BY CHINESE CLUBS 
Rafa Benitez could soon become the highest paid manager in the world, with a number of Chinese Super League clubs interested in the Newcastle boss, the Daily Mirror reports . 
According to the newspaper, the Spaniard, who has previously managed Liverpool and Real Madrid, would earn £30 million-a-year if he were to leave the Magpies. DE GEA CALLS MADRID OVER MOVE 
David de Gea has called Real Madrid to discuss the interest that Los Blancos are reported to have in Chelsea goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois, according to Don Ballon. 
The Spain international has long been a target of the European champions and is concerned any move for the Belgian could prevent him from one day making the move. INTER TO MOVE FOR JAMES 
Inter are to continue their pursuit of Real Madrid's James Rodriguez, according to Corriere dello Sport . 
The Serie A side tried to sign the Colombian in January and are willing to pay up to €80 million for the player. MAN UTD STEP UP NEYMAR PURSUIT 
Jose Mourinho has been in regular contact with Barcelona forward Neymar in an effort to get him to join Manchester United, according to Spanish newspaper Sport . 
The Red Devils boss is said to have spent several weeks attempting to convince the Brazilian that a move to Old Trafford would be beneficial to his career. MONACO NAME MBAPPE PRICE 
Monaco hope to recoup €60 million when they sell 18-year-old attacker Kylian Mbappe, Le Parisien reports . 
The forward made his mark in the Champions League match against Manchester City in midweek, when he caught the eye with a fine performance. After a stellar season to date in France, he is a player already on the radar of many of Europe's biggest sides. ARSENAL EYEING FORNALS 
Malaga midfielder Pablo Fornals has emerged as a summer transfer target for Arsenal, reports Marca . 
The 21-year-old has impressed in La Liga this season, netting four times, and is understood to have a buy-out clause of around £10 million in his contract. BLANC ON BARCA RADAR 
Laurent Blanc is among those being considered by Barcelona to replace Luis Enrique, with SFR Sport reporting that contact has already been made. 
The World Cup winner spent one year at Camp Nou during his playing days and, having been out of work since leaving Paris Saint-Germain, is a top target for Barca officials. CHELSEA TRACKING CASEMIRO 
Chelsea are keeping a close eye on Casemiro's situation at Real Madrid, according to DiarioGol . 
The Brazilian midfielder is reported to have demanded a salary increase amid talk of interest from Stamford Bridge and Manchester United. BARCA EYE ALLEGRI 
Barcelona are considering approaching Massimiliano Allegri about replacing Luis Enrique in the summer, according to calciomercato.com . 
The Blaugrana had previously been lining up coaches who fit into their strict philosophy, such as Mauricio Pochettino and Ronald Koeman, but are increasingly open to the idea of rivalling Arsenal for the Juventus manager. IBRAHIMOVIC STALLS ON UTD DEAL 
Zlatan Ibrahimovic is stalling on signing a contract extension at Manchester United, according to the Daily Mirror . 
The Swede is concerned about the Red Devils potentially missing out on the Champions League again and is reluctant to miss out on playing in the competition for a second straight season. REAL MADRID JOIN BRANDT RACE 
La Liga giants Real Madrid have joined Arsenal in the race to sign Bayer Leverkusen winger Julian Brandt, according to Talksport . 
The Bundesliga wideman has chipped in with six assists this season and is considered one of the brightest young talents in Germany, with an asking price of around £30 million. MANCINI TURNS DOWN LEICESTER 
Roberto Mancini has no interest in succeeding Claudio Ranieri as Leicester City's manager, according to Sky Sports . 
The media outlet earlier reported that the Foxes were had been hopeful of signing the former Manchester City boss, but now say the Italian will not pursue his coutnryman's vacant seat in the King Power dugout. SOUNDERS CLOSE IN ON HONDA 
AC Milan midfielder Keisuke Honda is closing in on a move to Seattle Sounders, according to TuttoMercatoWeb . 
The Serie A giants are willing to cancel the Japan international's contract early, paving the way for him to move to the MLS. YOUNG A £10M TARGET IN CHINA 
Chinese Super League outfit Shandong Luneng remain keen on signing Manchester United midfielder Ashley Young, according to Sky Sports . 
The Chinese club are said to be willing to pay £10 million for the 31-year-old England international, who has been out of favour at Old Trafford under Jose Mourinho. ARSENAL JOIN BAKAYOKO HUNT 
Arsenal have become the latest Premier League side to express an interest in Monaco midfielder Tiemoue Bakayoko, according to Le 10 Sport . 
Manchester United, Chelsea and Manchester City have already been linked with the 22-year-old, but the Gunners have now made his representatives aware that they would like to take him to the Emirates. EVERTON FAILED IN ROONEY BID 
Everton saw a January bid for Wayne Rooney knocked back by Manchester United, according to the Daily Mirror . 
The England captain has revealed that he will see out the season at Old Trafford, amid talk of a move to China, but he could make a return to Goodison Park over the summer. ATLETICO LINE UP GRIEZMANN REPLACEMENT 
Atletico Madrid are eager for Manchester United target Antoine Griezmann to spend one more year at the club but are already lining up Lyon's Alexandre Lacazette as his replacement, reports the Daily Telegraph . 
The France international is expected to be the subject of a big-money approach from Old Trafford over the summer, but he could also be paired with a fellow countryman in Spain next season. Related
